title.native: バジリスク 甲賀忍法帖

description:
The heirs to the Kouga and Iga ninja clans, Gennosuke and Oboro, hoped the unsteady truce between their tribes would last—but fate denies the lovers, thrusting their people into war after centuries of peace. The terms are set on two scrolls. One bears a list of Kouga warriors. The other holds a list of those who fight for Iga. The names found on these scrolls can only be crossed out in blood.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

title.native: バジリスク～甲賀忍法帖～
バジリスク ～桜花忍法帖～

node.description:
__Height:__ 153 cm 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NM_NANAPARTY) | [Website](https://www.mizukinana.jp/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mizukinanaKING) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/nanamizuki_nm7)

She is admired by many of her fellow actors and fans because of the fact that she has a great amount of power and strength in her singing voice, which surprises many fans due to her regularly petite stature. She was also the winner of the "Best Musical Performance" award in the first Seiyuu Awards. She was also part of the quartet Prits alongside Yumiko Kobayashi, Natsuko Kuwatani, and Hisayo Mochizuki (all four voiced characters in the anime _Sister Princess_). Her singing style comes from singing Enka since she was young.

In July 2020, she married someone from the music industry, and they had their first child on March 16, 2021.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Ittasha in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

A voice actress and producer specializing in televised anime. Harp was hired by FUNimation Entertainment in 2003 to voice the character of Tweedledee in Kiddy Grade. Since then, her work has included Sei in Burst Angel, Sanae in Akira Kurosawa's Samurai 7, Hibari Ginza in Speed Grapher and additional roles in Yu Yu Hakusho, Spiral, Fullmetal Alchemist, Case Closed, Desert Punk, Baki the Grappler, The Galaxy Railways, Negima, and BECK.    Her portrayal as Hibari Ginza in the 2006-2007 release of Speed Grapher won her an award in the ADR Awards as voted by members of the websites Dub Review and Anime on DVD.    Harp is also the inspiration for Aubrey Chorde, one of the main characters in the webcomic Something Positive by her friend R.K. Milholland. He claims he decided to make the comic after she told him to do "something positive" with his life. She currently lives and works in the Dallas/Ft. Worth area of Texas. Her hobbies include knitting, crafts and collecting Hello Kitty Memorabilia. (Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/osaki_fox)

Made his debut in 1997 with the series Senma Monogatari, which ran in the weekly magazine Comic Morning. In 1998 he began his long-running series Onigiri Jyuuzou, which ended in the year 2000. Basilisk is his second long-running series and his first adaptation. He loves cats and watermelon, and currently lives in Funibashi.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"
Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.

ONMYO-ZA has male and female vocalists fronting the band. Their song lyrics, characterized by classical Japanese words and expressions, reinforce the traditional  Japanese cultural image the band projects. Concepts of ‘ movement and stillness ‘, ‘darkness and light’, ‘resilience and yielding’, are typically explored in the music. Wearing traditional costumes typical of the Heian Period a thousand years ago, the band produces haunting melodies of great passion and elegance.     The music and the image of the band seem curiously mismatched at first, but an exquisite sense of balance effectively harmonizes apparent contradictions. Their music ranges from pop to hard rock. They have made a big impact in the two years since formation, thanks largely to their dynamic concerts.     Once seen in concert, fans never seem to tire of ONMYO-ZA. Underlying their own claims to this sort of loyalty from their followers is a natural confidence in their music and performances. The band’s track record provides conclusive proof of their enduring popularity. The band members are all fine musicians in their own right.     ONMYO-ZA are kicking off their longest ever nationwide tour of 42 concerts in the autumn of 2004, simultaneously releasing 3 maxi-singles for three consecutive months. With these concerts and releases they are sure to build on their success and go far.    from the official Onmyo-za website

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dmpmutation)

**Shinji Ishihira** is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

Known for challenging camera angles and his ultramodern usage of CG backgrounds. Him and [Hirofumi Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101188/) are known as the "Golden Combo" together and their most notable works are [Neoranga](https://anilist.co/anime/1163/) and [Kaze no Youjinbou](https://anilist.co/anime/1145/). The duo were also often seen working on episodes in the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) series.

His pen-name Yasuaki Kurozu (黒津安明), comes from the names of [Akira Kurosawa (黒澤明)](https://anilist.co/staff/100099/) and Yasujirou Ozu (小津安二郎), two prominent Japanese film directors.
Tyler Walker is an ADR Director, Script writer and voice actor for FUNimation.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田繁美)

Founder and representative director of Atelier Musa.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大西雅也)

Long-time key member of [Studio Pierrot](https://anilist.co/studio/1/). Married to [Takako Oonishi](https://anilist.co/staff/139180/).

He started his career at Studio Live working on outsourced episodes for a few years. His first major role was as mechanical designer on the short series [The Cosmopolitan Prayers](https://anilist.co/anime/112/).

After leaving Studio Live he was involved in several [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/) and [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) projects, with the former studio housing his debut as director on the short TOYOTA commercial series [PES: Peace Eco Smiles](https://anilist.co/anime/13427/).

He's been affiliated with Studio [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) since 2014 where he helmed his first TV Series, [Garo: The Animation](https://anilist.co/anime/20753/), and several other anime.

**Notable works outside anime:**

- Persona 5: Royal (Video Game, 2019) (OP Director, OP Storyboard, OP Key Animation)
